author: ankitchiplunkar
content: where does the storage (key value store) for the current 7702 lie? at the EOA address or the delegation contract?

author: gregthegreek
content:
Are there any outstanding draft PRs that would change 7702 or can I assume what’s currently merged is most up to date?

I ask because myself and others keep gaslighting one another over what’s latest and what isn’t

author: daniellehrner
content: There's a breakout call today to talk about the EIP. After that it might change again: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1118

author: lightclient
content:
> I think you meant PER_EMPTY_ACCOUNT_COST * effective_gas_price
It seems common for EIPs to drop `effective_gas_price` multiplier when discussing gas costs as it is implied when discussing that unit. I can make it clearer we're discussing gas though

> Authorizations are not rolled back for aborted transaction, so abort in this case also wouldn't roll back previous authorizations in the list (I guess it's fine or at least consistent)
This makes sense to me since there is nothing conditional about an authorization. If it is included, it's included. Only the execution can be conditional

> This changes the guarantee that valid transactions will not fail with not enough sender balance - i.e. extra balance check is required when transferring value
could you expand on this? i don't think i understand

author: lightclient
content: this might address some of your concerns https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8775

author: gumb00
content: thanks, charging it as intrinsic cost and refunding is less awkward way, yes

author: gumb00
content: this still needs to be changed/clarified I think

author: lightclient
content: 100 gas is for storage no? i think the warm account read is rolled into CALL* family?

author: gumb00
content:
account access too

EXTCODESIZE, EXTCODECOPY, EXTCODEHASH and CALLs  all charge 100 if warm, 2600 if cold

in 7702 they should be 100 or 2600 [+ 100 or 2600]

author: lightclient
content: ah you're right, i will update it

author: gregthegreek
content: dumb Q: how does current 7702 support sponsorship if the EOA needs to actually deploy the tx type?

author: daniellehrner
content: The EOA only needs to sign the autorization, not the tx. The tx sponsor includes the signed authorization into a 7702 transaction and sends it.
